actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with dominant military, economic, technological, and cultural influence. Leader in innovation, finance, and international diplomacy.

sub_actors.name: Executive Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Core executive branch leadership including the President, cabinet, and key advisors. Primary source of national policy direction and federal executive authority.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor and aerospace company that works extensively with the Executive Office through military contracts, national security initiatives, and space exploration programs. Major influence on defense policy, military procurement, and strategic technology development.

sub_actors.name: United States Congress
sub_actors.description: Federal legislative branch comprising Senate and House of Representatives. Controls federal budget, legislation, and oversight of executive branch.

sub_actors.name: Amazon.com, Inc.
sub_actors.description: Tech and e-commerce giant with extensive lobbying presence, major federal contracts, and significant influence on digital commerce, cloud computing (AWS), and labor policies. Heavy investment in congressional lobbying, particularly on tech regulation, antitrust issues, and federal procurement.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central bank managing national monetary policy, banking supervision, and financial stability. Controls interest rates and money supply.

sub_actors.name: JPMorgan Chase & Co.
sub_actors.description: Largest U.S. bank by assets, primary dealer of U.S. Treasury securities, and major participant in Federal Reserve operations. Significant influence on monetary policy implementation, financial markets, and banking sector stability. Key player in Fed's discount window operations and payment systems.

sub_actors.name: Department of Defense
sub_actors.description: Manages all military forces and national defense policy. Largest department by budget with extensive global presence and strategic influence.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor and aerospace company, providing advanced technology systems, aircraft, missiles, and military platforms. Primary supplier for F-35 fighter jets and numerous critical defense systems. Largest defense contractor by revenue with extensive R&D capabilities and strategic importance to national security.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Court of the United States
sub_actors.description: Highest federal court and constitutional interpreter. Final arbiter of federal law and constitutional questions.

sub_actors.name: Thomson Reuters Westlaw
sub_actors.description: Premier legal research and technology company providing essential legal databases, analytics, and tools used extensively by Supreme Court justices, clerks, and legal professionals. Their systems are critical for case research, legal document preparation, and precedent analysis at the Supreme Court level.
sub_actors.parent_actor: Supreme Court of the United States

sub_actors.name: Department of State
sub_actors.description: Lead foreign affairs agency conducting diplomacy and international relations. Shapes global policy and manages foreign service.

sub_actors.name: Diplomatic Security Global Solutions (DSGS)
sub_actors.description: Major contractor providing security, logistics, training and technical support services to US diplomatic missions worldwide. Critical partner in embassy operations, diplomatic security, and overseas facility management.

sub_actors.name: National Security Council
sub_actors.description: Principal forum for national security policy decisions and coordination between military, intelligence, and diplomatic agencies.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor providing advanced technology systems, aerospace products, and security solutions directly supporting NSC strategic capabilities. Primary supplier of military aircraft, missile systems, and cybersecurity infrastructure critical to national security operations.

sub_actors.name: Department of the Treasury
sub_actors.description: Manages federal finances, tax collection, public debt, and financial intelligence. Key economic policy advisor to President.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
sub_actors.description: The largest and most influential of the 12 Federal Reserve Banks, executing monetary policy operations, supervising financial institutions, and serving as the U.S. government's primary dealer in securities. Manages the System Open Market Account for the Federal Reserve System and operates critical payment and settlement systems.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: Rising superpower with world's largest population, second-largest economy, growing military capabilities, and extensive global infrastructure initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: Ruling political party that controls all aspects of governance, sets national policy, and maintains absolute leadership over state, military, and society

sub_actors.name: Sinopec Group
sub_actors.description: China's largest oil and gas producer and supplier, state-owned energy and chemical conglomerate that controls significant portions of China's energy infrastructure and overseas energy investments. Critical to national energy security and economic development.

sub_actors.name: Central Military Commission
sub_actors.description: Supreme military command organization that controls the People's Liberation Army, nuclear forces, and military policy

sub_actors.name: Norinco Group
sub_actors.description: China's largest state-owned defense corporation and a global leader in military equipment manufacturing. Produces tanks, ammunition, firearms, and military technology. Key supplier to PLA and major international defense exporter with significant R&D capabilities.

sub_actors.name: State Council
sub_actors.description: Chief administrative authority of China, executing laws and managing daily governance of the nation

sub_actors.name: Sinopec Group
sub_actors.description: China's largest oil and petrochemical company, state-owned enterprise that controls significant portions of China's energy sector. Major global player in oil refining and production, with extensive downstream operations and retail networks across China. Critical to national energy security and economic development.

sub_actors.name: Politburo Standing Committee
sub_actors.description: Top decision-making body within the CCP, comprising 7 most powerful leaders who shape all major national policies

sub_actors.name: State Grid Corporation of China
sub_actors.description: World's largest utility company and state-owned enterprise, controlling China's national power grid. Critical to national infrastructure and energy security, serving over 1.1 billion people. Direct operational oversight from Politburo Standing Committee with massive influence on industrial policy and economic planning.

sub_actors.name: People's Bank of China
sub_actors.description: Central bank controlling monetary policy, currency management, and financial system regulation

sub_actors.name: China UnionPay
sub_actors.description: China's largest card payment organization and a critical financial infrastructure provider, processing the majority of domestic card transactions and connecting nearly all banks in China. As a state-owned financial services corporation established under PBOC's authority, it plays a vital role in China's payment system and international payment network expansion.

sub_actors.name: Ministry of State Security
sub_actors.description: Principal intelligence and security agency handling domestic and foreign intelligence operations

sub_actors.name: China Electronics Technology Group Corporation (CETC)
sub_actors.description: State-owned enterprise specializing in electronic and information technology systems, providing critical surveillance and security technology to the Ministry of State Security. Develops advanced intelligence gathering equipment, cybersecurity systems, and communication networks essential for national security operations.

sub_actors.name: National Development and Reform Commission
sub_actors.description: Macroeconomic management agency that controls economic planning, reforms, and strategic projects

sub_actors.name: State Grid Corporation of China
sub_actors.description: World's largest utility company and state-owned enterprise, responsible for power transmission and distribution across 26 Chinese provinces. Controls China's main power grid infrastructure and plays a crucial role in national energy policy implementation and development.

sub_actors.name: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
sub_actors.description: Chief anti-corruption agency with broad powers to investigate party members and government officials

sub_actors.name: China Discipline Inspection Daily
sub_actors.description: Official state-owned media outlet and publishing house of the CCDI, responsible for disseminating disciplinary news, investigation reports, and anti-corruption content. Plays a crucial role in shaping public perception and communicating CCDI's activities.

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Powerful economic and political union of 27 states, representing significant trade bloc and regulatory influence.

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch of the EU, proposes legislation, implements decisions, upholds treaties, and represents EU internationally. Led by Commission President.

sub_actors.name: TotalEnergies SE
sub_actors.description: Major French multinational energy company with significant influence on EU energy policy, infrastructure development, and climate initiatives. Key stakeholder in European energy markets and strategic partnerships with the Commission on green transition policies.

sub_actors.name: European Council
sub_actors.description: Comprises heads of state/government of member states, sets EU's political direction and priorities at highest level.

sub_actors.name: BusinessEurope
sub_actors.description: The largest and most influential business lobbying organization in the EU, representing 40 national business federations from 35 countries and actively shaping EU policy decisions through direct engagement with the European Council. Acts as the primary voice of enterprises across Europe, representing over 20 million companies.

sub_actors.name: European Parliament
sub_actors.description: Directly elected legislative body that passes EU laws jointly with Council, supervises institutions, and adopts EU budgets.

sub_actors.name: BusinessEurope
sub_actors.description: The largest and most influential business lobbying organization in the EU, representing over 40 national business federations from 35 countries. Directly shapes EU legislation through extensive lobbying efforts, policy proposals, and close relationships with EU lawmakers. Represents interests of major European corporations across all sectors.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Controls EU monetary policy, manages euro, and supervises banking system across eurozone.

sub_actors.name: Deutsche Bank AG
sub_actors.description: Germany's largest bank and one of Europe's most systemically important financial institutions. Key participant in ECB monetary operations, primary dealer in government securities, and major provider of financial services across the Eurozone. Significant influence on European financial markets and monetary policy implementation.

sub_actors.name: Council of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Voice of EU member governments, adopts laws and coordinates policies. Different ministers meet based on policy area.

sub_actors.name: BusinessEurope
sub_actors.description: The largest and most influential business lobbying organization in the EU, representing over 40 national business federations from 35 countries. Directly influences EU policy-making, particularly in areas of trade, competition, industrial strategy and environmental regulations. Has significant impact on Council decisions through coordinated industry positions.

sub_actors.name: Court of Justice of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Ensures EU law is interpreted and applied uniformly across member states, resolves legal disputes.

sub_actors.name: Wolters Kluwer Legal & Regulatory
sub_actors.description: Leading global provider of legal research solutions, case law databases, and compliance tools extensively used by the CJEU and legal practitioners across the EU. Their legal information systems and publications are critical for accessing and analyzing EU case law and legal documentation.
sub_actors.parent_actor: Court of Justice of the European Union

sub_actors.name: European External Action Service
sub_actors.description: EU's diplomatic service, implements foreign and security policy, manages diplomatic relations and strategic partnerships.

sub_actors.name: Airbus Defence and Space
sub_actors.description: Major aerospace and defense contractor providing satellite communications, security systems, and defense technology to EEAS. Critical supplier for EU's diplomatic and security infrastructure, including the Galileo satellite program and border security systems.

sub_actors.name: European Banking Authority
sub_actors.description: Regulatory agency ensuring effective banking supervision across EU, creates banking standards and stress tests.

sub_actors.name: BNP Paribas
sub_actors.description: Largest bank in the European Union by total assets, heavily involved in EBA stress tests and regulatory compliance. Significant influence on EU banking policy and implementation of Basel standards. Major contributor to banking sector consultations and regulatory frameworks.

actors.name: Meta Platforms
actors.description: Controls dominant social media platforms affecting global communication, information flow, and public discourse for billions.

sub_actors.name: Meta Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Highest governing body providing strategic oversight, major policy decisions, and corporate governance. Controls company direction and executive accountability.

sub_actors.name: Meta Platforms Inc.
sub_actors.description: Global social media and technology conglomerate operating Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Reality Labs. Primary operating company controlled by the board, managing core social networking platforms, metaverse development, and digital advertising business.

sub_actors.name: Meta Executive Leadership Team
sub_actors.description: C-suite executives led by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, responsible for day-to-day operations, product strategy, and company-wide policy implementation.

sub_actors.name: Instagram
sub_actors.description: Major social media platform subsidiary acquired by Meta (formerly Facebook) in 2012. Key revenue generator through advertising, with over 2 billion monthly active users. Drives significant portion of Meta's growth and social media market dominance.

sub_actors.name: Meta Oversight Board
sub_actors.description: Independent content moderation body making binding decisions on platform governance, content policies, and user appeals.

sub_actors.name: Meta Platforms, Inc.
sub_actors.description: Parent company that established and funds the Oversight Board, operating major social platforms including Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp. While the Board is independent, Meta remains its primary stakeholder and implementation partner for content moderation decisions.

sub_actors.name: Meta Policy and Communications
sub_actors.description: Division managing regulatory affairs, public policy, government relations, and external communications strategy globally.

sub_actors.name: Facebook Ireland Limited
sub_actors.description: Primary operational entity for Meta's European operations, handling policy compliance, GDPR regulations, and government relations across the EU region. Critical for managing Meta's regulatory affairs and communications strategy in one of its largest markets.

sub_actors.name: Meta Security Operations
sub_actors.description: Department responsible for platform integrity, security protocols, and protecting against threats to company infrastructure and user data.

sub_actors.name: Crowdstrike
sub_actors.description: Leading cybersecurity provider partnering with Meta for advanced threat detection, incident response, and security infrastructure protection. Provides critical endpoint security solutions and AI-driven threat intelligence to safeguard Meta's global digital assets and user data.

sub_actors.name: Meta Product Development
sub_actors.description: Division controlling product roadmap, feature development, and technical implementation across all Meta platforms.

sub_actors.name: Instagram LLC
sub_actors.description: Key subsidiary responsible for the Instagram platform development, user experience innovation, and feature integration within Meta's ecosystem. Drives significant user engagement and advertising revenue through continuous product evolution and social media innovation.

sub_actors.name: Meta AI Research (FAIR)
sub_actors.description: Research division developing artificial intelligence technologies that influence platform algorithms and future capabilities.

sub_actors.name: PyTorch Foundation
sub_actors.description: Leading open-source machine learning framework originally developed by FAIR, now an independent entity under Linux Foundation. Powers major AI research and development across industry and academia, serving as the primary framework for Meta's AI initiatives and research publications.

sub_actors.name: Meta Reality Labs
sub_actors.description: Division focusing on metaverse development, VR/AR technologies, and next-generation platform evolution.

sub_actors.name: Oculus VR
sub_actors.description: Leading VR hardware and software subsidiary acquired by Meta, responsible for developing the Quest VR headset line and core VR technologies that power Meta's metaverse ambitions. Primary driver of Reality Labs' consumer products and platform development.

actors.name: United Nations
actors.description: Primary international organization for global governance, peace-keeping, and humanitarian coordination.

sub_actors.name: UN Security Council
sub_actors.description: Primary decision-making body for international peace and security, with power to issue binding resolutions and authorize military action

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Global aerospace and defense corporation that significantly influences UN Security Council decisions through its role as a major military contractor. Supplies advanced weapons systems, aircraft, and defense technology to multiple permanent Security Council members, particularly the United States. Their products and services directly impact international security policies and military interventions.

sub_actors.name: UN General Assembly
sub_actors.description: Main deliberative body where all member states have equal representation, sets policies and budget

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
sub_actors.description: Global technology leader providing critical digital infrastructure and services to UN operations, including cloud computing, productivity software, and digital transformation solutions. Major partner in UN initiatives for sustainable development, digital inclusion, and technological capacity building across member states.

sub_actors.name: UN Secretariat
sub_actors.description: Executive arm led by Secretary-General, manages operations and implements policies

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
sub_actors.description: Strategic technology partner providing digital infrastructure, cloud services, and software solutions for UN operations. Major contributor to UN's digital transformation initiatives and sustainable development goals through technology partnerships.

sub_actors.name: UN Economic and Social Council
sub_actors.description: Coordinates economic, social, and environmental work of UN agencies and bodies

sub_actors.name: McKinsey & Company
sub_actors.description: Global management consulting firm that frequently advises ECOSOC and its subsidiary bodies on economic policy, sustainable development, and organizational strategy. Significant influence through policy recommendations, research publications, and direct consultation with member states.

sub_actors.name: UN Department of Peacekeeping Operations
sub_actors.description: Plans, prepares, manages, and directs UN peacekeeping operations worldwide

sub_actors.name: PAE Applied Technologies
sub_actors.description: Major defense contractor providing logistics, training, and operational support services to UN peacekeeping missions worldwide. Manages base operations, supplies critical equipment, and delivers specialized training to peacekeeping forces across multiple conflict zones.

sub_actors.name: International Court of Justice
sub_actors.description: Principal judicial organ of the UN, settles legal disputes between states

sub_actors.name: LexisNexis Legal & Professional
sub_actors.description: Global provider of legal research and analytics tools used extensively by the ICJ and legal professionals worldwide. Their databases and case management systems are crucial for international law proceedings and documentation at the ICJ.

sub_actors.name: UN Human Rights Council
sub_actors.description: Inter-governmental body responsible for promoting and protecting human rights worldwide

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
sub_actors.description: Major technology partner providing digital infrastructure, AI solutions, and cybersecurity services to the UNHRC. Significantly influences human rights policies in digital spaces and contributes expertise on technology's impact on human rights. Partners in multiple UNHRC initiatives focused on digital rights and accessibility.

sub_actors.name: UN Development Programme
sub_actors.description: Global development network focusing on poverty reduction and sustainable development

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
sub_actors.description: Key technology partner for UNDP's digital transformation initiatives, providing cloud infrastructure, software solutions, and technical expertise for development projects. Major contributor to UNDP's Digital Strategy through partnerships in AI, data analytics, and digital governance solutions.

actors.name: NATO
actors.description: Powerful military alliance ensuring collective defense and security cooperation among 31 North American and European nations.

sub_actors.name: North Atlantic Council (NAC)
sub_actors.description: Principal political decision-making body of NATO where each member nation has a seat. Makes major strategic and policy decisions requiring unanimous consent.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Premier global defense and aerospace corporation that provides critical military hardware, systems, and technology to NATO member states. Primary contractor for NATO's major defense systems including F-35 fighter jets, missile defense systems, and military communications infrastructure. Their technologies and systems are integral to NATO's collective defense capabilities and interoperability standards.

sub_actors.name: Military Committee (MC)
sub_actors.description: Senior military authority providing strategic advice to NAC and directing NATO's military operations through Strategic Commands.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor providing advanced military technology, aircraft, missile systems, and combat vehicles to NATO forces. Primary supplier of F-35 fighters and other critical military hardware to NATO member states, with significant influence on military procurement decisions and strategic capabilities.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR)
sub_actors.description: Commands all NATO military operations and oversees strategic planning for Alliance military activities.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor providing advanced military systems, aircraft, missiles, and command & control solutions to NATO forces. Primary supplier of F-35 fighter jets and critical military technology to SACEUR-commanded operations. Deeply integrated with NATO's military infrastructure and strategic planning.

sub_actors.name: NATO Secretary General Office
sub_actors.description: Chief spokesperson and principal political leader of NATO, chairs the NAC and oversees strategic direction.

sub_actors.name: BAE Systems
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense, aerospace, and security company that supplies NATO with advanced military equipment, cybersecurity solutions, and defense technology. Key contractor for NATO's military modernization programs and strategic defense capabilities.

sub_actors.name: Allied Command Operations (ACO)
sub_actors.description: Responsible for planning and executing all NATO military operations, headquartered at SHAPE in Belgium.

sub_actors.name: Thales Group
sub_actors.description: Major defense and aerospace corporation providing critical command & control systems, radar systems, and cybersecurity solutions to NATO operations. Key contractor for ACO's technological infrastructure and communications systems at SHAPE headquarters.

sub_actors.name: NATO Intelligence and Security Division
sub_actors.description: Provides strategic intelligence analysis and security risk assessments to support NATO decision-making.

sub_actors.name: Thales Group
sub_actors.description: Major defense and security multinational providing critical intelligence systems, cybersecurity solutions, and advanced technology platforms to NATO's Intelligence Division. Key supplier of secure communications infrastructure and data analysis tools used in NATO intelligence operations.

sub_actors.name: Nuclear Planning Group (NPG)
sub_actors.description: High-level body responsible for nuclear policy and planning within the Alliance framework.

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading global defense contractor providing advanced nuclear weapons systems, missile technology, and strategic deterrence solutions to NATO members. Key supplier of nuclear-capable delivery systems and technical consulting for NPG nuclear planning initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Science and Technology Organization (STO)
sub_actors.description: NATO's principal organization for science and technology research, fostering innovation in defense capabilities.

sub_actors.name: Thales Group
sub_actors.description: Major defense and aerospace corporation heavily involved in NATO's technology initiatives, providing advanced electronics, cybersecurity solutions, and defense systems. Key contributor to STO research programs and technical demonstrations, particularly in C4I systems and military communications.

actors.name: Apple Inc.
actors.description: Tech giant with massive market influence, setting global standards in technology, consumer behavior, and digital ecosystems.

sub_actors.name: Apple Executive Team
sub_actors.description: Top-level leadership team headed by CEO, making strategic decisions and setting company direction across all divisions and products

sub_actors.name: Apple Inc.
sub_actors.description: World's most valuable technology company and parent corporation, designing and manufacturing consumer electronics, software, and services including iPhone, Mac, iPad, and Apple Services. Primary entity controlled and directed by the executive team.

sub_actors.name: Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Governing body providing oversight, strategic guidance, and major corporate decisions approval

sub_actors.name: BlackRock, Inc.
sub_actors.description: World's largest asset management firm with significant board representation across major corporations, influencing corporate governance, voting decisions, and strategic direction through its massive shareholdings and proxy voting power

sub_actors.name: Product Development Division
sub_actors.description: Core division responsible for iPhone, iPad, Mac and other flagship product development and innovation

sub_actors.name: Foxconn Technology Group
sub_actors.description: World's largest electronics manufacturer and Apple's primary assembly partner for iPhones, iPads, and other flagship products. Operates massive production facilities and employs hundreds of thousands of workers. Critical to product development through manufacturing expertise and supply chain innovation.

sub_actors.name: Software Engineering Division
sub_actors.description: Controls iOS, macOS development and ecosystem integration, critical for product functionality and user experience

sub_actors.name: Apple Software Development LLC
sub_actors.description: Core software development unit responsible for iOS and macOS platforms, managing thousands of engineers and billions in development resources. Controls platform architecture, API development, and ecosystem integration standards.

sub_actors.name: Operations and Supply Chain
sub_actors.description: Manages global manufacturing, logistics, and supply chain operations essential for product delivery

sub_actors.name: Amazon.com, Inc.
sub_actors.description: Global e-commerce and technology leader with revolutionary logistics and supply chain operations, operating the world's most sophisticated fulfillment network. Pioneer in warehouse automation, last-mile delivery innovation, and inventory management systems.

sub_actors.name: Services Division
sub_actors.description: Manages Apple's growing services ecosystem including App Store, Apple Music, iCloud, and other digital services

sub_actors.name: Apple Services LLC
sub_actors.description: Core operational entity managing Apple's digital services ecosystem including App Store, Apple Music, Apple TV+, iCloud, Apple Arcade, and Apple News+. Handles content distribution, developer relationships, and subscription services generating over $50B in annual revenue.

sub_actors.name: Legal and Global Security
sub_actors.description: Handles legal compliance, intellectual property, security, and regulatory affairs worldwide

sub_actors.name: Thomson Reuters
sub_actors.description: Global leader in legal information services, compliance solutions, and security intelligence. Provides critical data, research tools, and regulatory compliance platforms to legal professionals and security firms worldwide. Major influence on legal technology and information systems.

sub_actors.name: Marketing and Communications
sub_actors.description: Controls brand messaging, product launches, and global marketing strategies

sub_actors.name: WPP plc
sub_actors.description: World's largest advertising and communications holding company, operating major agencies like Ogilvy, GroupM, and VMLY&R. Controls significant portion of global advertising spend and shapes international marketing trends.

actors.name: Russian Federation
actors.description: Major military power with significant energy resources, nuclear capabilities, and geopolitical influence.

sub_actors.name: Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Executive office holding supreme authority over state affairs, military command, and foreign policy, with extensive constitutional powers and direct control over security services

sub_actors.name: Presidential Business Operations Corporation
sub_actors.description: State-owned enterprise managing presidential properties, facilities, and business operations. Oversees government assets, presidential security infrastructure, and executive office operations. Controls significant government contracts and procurement for the executive branch.

sub_actors.name: Security Council of Russia
sub_actors.description: Presidential advisory body coordinating national security policy, military doctrine, and strategic planning with key government and security leaders

sub_actors.name: Rostec
sub_actors.description: State-owned defense conglomerate controlling Russia's military-industrial complex, aerospace technology, and advanced manufacturing. Produces everything from military equipment to civilian products, employing over 500,000 people across 700 subsidiaries. Critical supplier to Russian armed forces and major export revenue generator.

sub_actors.name: Federal Security Service (FSB)
sub_actors.description: Primary security agency handling counter-intelligence, internal security, and border protection with extensive domestic surveillance capabilities

sub_actors.name: Kaspersky Lab
sub_actors.description: Major cybersecurity company with close ties to FSB, providing security software and intelligence. Known for antivirus products and threat detection systems, the company has faced international scrutiny over alleged collaboration with Russian security services.

sub_actors.name: Russian Armed Forces
sub_actors.description: Unified military command structure controlling all military branches, nuclear forces, and conducting military operations domestically and abroad

sub_actors.name: Rostec
sub_actors.description: State-owned defense conglomerate that develops, produces and exports high-tech industrial products for civil and military use. Controls over 700 organizations including key military manufacturers like United Aircraft Corporation, Russian Helicopters, and Kalashnikov Concern. Produces aircraft, weapons, electronic warfare systems and military equipment.

sub_actors.name: United Russia Party
sub_actors.description: Dominant political party holding constitutional majority in parliament, implementing presidential policies and maintaining political control

sub_actors.name: Gazprom
sub_actors.description: State-controlled energy corporation and largest natural gas company in Russia. Significant contributor to state budget and key instrument of Russian energy policy. Close ties to United Russia Party leadership and crucial role in implementing state economic strategies.

sub_actors.name: Ministry of Defense
sub_actors.description: Controls military budget, defense procurement, and military strategy implementation, directly oversees armed forces operations

sub_actors.name: Lockheed Martin Corporation
sub_actors.description: Global aerospace, defense, and security company that is one of the largest defense contractors worldwide. Primary supplier of advanced military aircraft, missile systems, and military technology. Critical partner in numerous defense programs and strategic capabilities development.

sub_actors.name: Central Bank of Russia
sub_actors.description: National financial regulator controlling monetary policy, currency operations, and banking sector oversight

sub_actors.name: Sberbank
sub_actors.description: Russia's largest state-owned bank controlling about one-third of all banking assets in Russia. Provides comprehensive financial services, digital ecosystem solutions, and plays a crucial role in implementing CBR's monetary policies. Major player in retail and corporate banking with extensive national coverage.

sub_actors.name: Gazprom
sub_actors.description: State-controlled energy corporation wielding significant economic influence through control of natural gas resources and export infrastructure

sub_actors.name: Gazprom Neft
sub_actors.description: Major oil subsidiary of Gazprom focused on oil exploration, production, and refining. One of Russia's largest oil producers, operating key refineries and extensive retail network of filling stations. Controls significant upstream and downstream operations across Russia and internationally.

actors.name: International Monetary Fund
actors.description: Key institution in global financial system, influencing international monetary policies and economic stability.

sub_actors.name: Executive Board
sub_actors.description: Primary decision-making body that exercises most powers of the IMF Board of Governors, consisting of 24 Directors representing member countries or groups of countries

sub_actors.name: Goldman Sachs
sub_actors.description: Global investment banking firm with significant influence on IMF policy through advisory roles, financial consulting, and former executives in key positions. Provides crucial economic analysis and financial market expertise to the Executive Board's decision-making process.

sub_actors.name: Board of Governors
sub_actors.description: Highest decision-making body consisting of one governor and one alternate governor for each member country, typically finance ministers or central bank heads

sub_actors.name: Goldman Sachs Group
sub_actors.description: Global investment banking and securities firm that significantly influences monetary policy through research, advisory roles, and former executives in government positions. Provides critical financial analysis and recommendations that inform Board of Governors' decisions.

sub_actors.name: Managing Director's Office
sub_actors.description: Leadership office headed by the Managing Director who oversees the IMF's operations, policy direction, and serves as chair of the Executive Board

sub_actors.name: JP Morgan Chase
sub_actors.description: Global financial services firm that frequently interacts with and advises the IMF Managing Director's Office on international financial markets, monetary policy, and global economic trends. Provides critical market intelligence and serves as a key implementation partner for various IMF initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Strategy, Policy, and Review Department
sub_actors.description: Central department responsible for developing IMF policies and ensuring consistency in IMF policy advice and lending practices

sub_actors.name: McKinsey & Company
sub_actors.description: Global management consulting firm that frequently advises the IMF's Strategy, Policy, and Review Department on organizational strategy, policy implementation, and economic analysis. Provides critical consulting services for policy framework development and institutional reforms.

sub_actors.name: Research Department
sub_actors.description: Produces key economic analysis and research that underpins IMF policy advice and global economic surveillance

sub_actors.name: Bloomberg L.P.
sub_actors.description: Global financial data and media company providing critical economic data, analysis tools, and financial software that the Research Department heavily relies on for global economic monitoring and research. Their terminals and databases are essential for tracking real-time economic indicators and market movements.

sub_actors.name: International Monetary and Financial Committee
sub_actors.description: Advisory body that provides strategic direction to the work and policies of the IMF

sub_actors.name: BlackRock, Inc.
sub_actors.description: World's largest asset management firm with significant influence on global financial markets and monetary policy. Provides advisory services and research to central banks and international financial institutions, including those involved with the IMFC. Their analysis and investment decisions can significantly impact international monetary policies.

sub_actors.name: Area Departments
sub_actors.description: Regional divisions responsible for country-specific policy implementation and monitoring across different geographical regions

sub_actors.name: Regional Development Corporation
sub_actors.description: Leading multinational consulting and development firm specializing in regional economic planning, policy implementation, and infrastructure development across geographical zones. Partners with governments to execute area-specific development strategies and monitors policy effectiveness.

sub_actors.name: Finance Department
sub_actors.description: Manages the IMF's financial resources and operations, including lending policies and quota system

sub_actors.name: BlackRock
sub_actors.description: World's largest asset management firm providing crucial financial advisory services and investment management expertise to the Finance Department, particularly in areas of sovereign debt management and global market analysis. Their risk assessment tools and market intelligence significantly influence IMF's financial decision-making processes.

actors.name: Alphabet Inc.
actors.description: Parent company of Google, controlling crucial digital infrastructure, information access, and technological innovation.

sub_actors.name: Google LLC
sub_actors.description: Core subsidiary managing search, advertising, cloud services, and primary revenue streams. Controls key digital infrastructure and technology development.

sub_actors.name: YouTube, LLC
sub_actors.description: World's largest video sharing platform and streaming service. Critical revenue generator through advertising, subscriptions, and content monetization. Drives massive user engagement and cultural influence globally.

sub_actors.name: Alphabet Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Supreme governing body making final decisions on company strategy, acquisitions, and leadership appointments.

sub_actors.name: Google LLC
sub_actors.description: Primary revenue generator for Alphabet, operating the world's dominant search engine, digital advertising platform, and numerous internet services. Controls key technology infrastructure including Android OS, Chrome browser, and Google Cloud. Generates over 80% of Alphabet's total revenue.

sub_actors.name: Google AI/DeepMind
sub_actors.description: Leads artificial intelligence research and development, shaping future technology capabilities and strategic direction.

sub_actors.name: Isomorphic Labs
sub_actors.description: A DeepMind spin-off company focused on using AI for drug discovery and development. Leverages DeepMind's AI technology and expertise to revolutionize the pharmaceutical industry through computational approaches to drug design and molecular modeling.

sub_actors.name: Google Cloud
sub_actors.description: Manages cloud computing infrastructure and enterprise services, critical for revenue growth and market expansion.

sub_actors.name: Kubernetes
sub_actors.description: Open-source container orchestration platform originally developed by Google, now managed by CNCF. Critical to Google Cloud's infrastructure and cloud-native solutions, driving widespread adoption of containerization and microservices architecture across the industry.

sub_actors.name: YouTube
sub_actors.description: Controls global video distribution platform, influencing content policies and digital advertising.

sub_actors.name: Google Advertising
sub_actors.description: Primary advertising and monetization engine for YouTube, controlling the platform's revenue generation, ad placement algorithms, and creator monetization policies. Manages multi-billion dollar advertising ecosystem and determines commercial viability of content.

sub_actors.name: X Development LLC
sub_actors.description: Research facility for moonshot technologies, directing long-term innovation strategy and future ventures.

sub_actors.name: Google Research
sub_actors.description: Primary research and development arm providing technological foundations, AI expertise, and innovative solutions that power X Development's moonshot projects. Contributes essential machine learning capabilities, computational resources, and technical talent.

sub_actors.name: Android Division
sub_actors.description: Manages mobile operating system development, controlling smartphone ecosystem and app distribution.

sub_actors.name: Samsung Electronics
sub_actors.description: Largest Android device manufacturer globally, wielding significant influence over Android's development direction through market dominance and strategic partnership with Google. Controls major share of Android smartphone market and drives hardware innovation standards.

sub_actors.name: Waymo
sub_actors.description: Autonomous vehicle technology division, leading development in self-driving transportation systems.

sub_actors.name: Alphabet Inc.
sub_actors.description: Parent company of Waymo, providing strategic direction, financial backing, and technological resources. As one of the world's most valuable companies, Alphabet's support has been crucial in Waymo's development of autonomous vehicle technology and market expansion.
